column1: This creepy robot can explore nuclear sites and deliver pizza
column3: A team of engineers from Oregon State University recently unveiled a new walking robot called Cassie that they say can revolutionize the delivery and shipping industries.

column1: Read this now: Deadly plane crash in Australia｜Verdict divides Israel｜Amazon lowers shipping minimum
column3: Here are some of the key stories CNBC is following this hour:

column1: There's no such thing as free shipping: UPS APAC president
column3: Amazon might be muscling its way into delivery services, but this is not necessarily a competitive issue for traditional logistics companies such as UPS.
A South Korean court picked a bankruptcy administrator and says any claims by creditors will be due by May 1.

column1: World's largest shipping firm says demand has outgrown supply for first time since 2010
column3: Danish shipping and oil group A.P. Moller-Maersk missed fourth-quarter net profit forecasts on Wednesday but said it expects a higher annual underlying profit this year.

column1: Global trade creates wealth: Maersk Group CEO
column3: Maersk Group CEO Søren Skou talks about whether 2017 could bring more weakness to the container shipping market.

column1: Cramer: Two-day shipping spoiled us all, so be patient with Amazon
column3: Jim Cramer broke down Amazon’s fourth-quarter earnings, and why he thinks the stock will recover.

column1: Shipping rates could get worse under Trump: CEO
column3: Overcapacity in the shipping industry has left hundreds of ships idle. Trump's protectionist policies could make things worse, a CEO warns CNBC.

column1: Amazon opening new air cargo hub
column3: CNBC's Morgan Brennan reports on how Amazon is expanding its shipping capabilities with its new air cargo hub.

column1: Shipping industry vulnerable to cyber attacks and GPS jamming
column3: The shipping industry is increasingly at risk from cybersecurity attacks and a gap in insurance policies is leaving them vulnerable.
